Global vs. Local
▪ Global classifiers
– Fit a single model to the entire data set
– Unless the model is highly nonlinear, this one-size-fits-all strategy may 
not be effective
▪ Local classifiers
– Partition the input space into smaller regions and fit a distinct model to 
training instances in each region (e.g., the k-nearest neighbor classifier)
– More flexible, but more susceptible to model overfitting
